intro: Luzula beringensis, commonly known as the Bering sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in wet, boggy environments and is often found in tundra and alpine habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Luzula beringensis is adapted to cold climates and can survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-latitude ecosystems.
